text.0: We do have safe & effective vaccines for #influenza. @WHO recommends influenza vaccination for the following target groups: pregnant women, people with underlying health conditions, children & during #COVID19 the highest priority should be given to older adults & #healthworkers.
text.1:
The co-circulation of #influenza and #COVID19 may present challenges for health systems & health facilities, since both diseases present with many similar symptoms.

https://t.co/9ZhIFGkQX3
text.2: Cases of #COVID19 are rising globally, and #influenza season is approaching in the Northern hemisphere. Every hospital bed occupied by a patient with COVID-19 is a bed that is unavailable for someone with another condition or disease, such as influenza.
text.3:
WHO and Vital Strategies help protect the heart health of over :keycap_digit_three: million people in 18 countries.

Read the successful stories from around the world:backhand_index_pointing_right:https://t.co/gsPZOd4d4p #BeatNCDs https://t.co/qcBauGJEDk
text.4:
You can control high blood pressure:

:black_small_square_selector:Follow:adult:‍:medical_symbol_selector::woman_health_worker_selector:advice and adhere to lifestyle changes
:black_small_square_selector:Take :pill: as prescribed
:black_small_square_selector:Regularly check blood pressure
:black_small_square_selector:Reduce and manage stress

#BeatNCDs https://t.co/dwTARHImuw
text.5: Find out how your country is managing hypertension in the :NEW_button: WHO hypertension factsheets :backhand_index_pointing_right:https://t.co/UJWFv9JGY4 https://t.co/R8EwwD3Xyk
text.6: During the pandemic, people with pre-existing health conditions such as #hypertension become more vulnerable not only because they are more susceptible to the virus but also due to the medical resources that have to be directed towards caring for patients with #COVID19. https://t.co/0QaFPbz0Se
text.7:
'Lockdowns' are immensely costly to societies, economies & individuals, but may be used to stop #COVID19 outbreaks. During 'lockdowns', governments must do all they can to build their public health capacities to be ready for when the 'lockdown' lifts. 
 
:backhand_index_pointing_right:https://t.co/X9N7zcyfOX https://t.co/Iefmn3VF09
text.8:
Most people who are infected with #COVID19 develop an immune response within the first few weeks after infection. Research is still ongoing into how strong that protection is and how long it lasts.

:backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/X9N7zcyfOX https://t.co/o6esQI7k5C
text.9:
Lack of access to healthy food, or consumption of unhealthy, high-calorie diets, are now the single largest cause of global ill health. 

Include more:peach::green_apple::carrot: in your diet to stay healthy https://t.co/SLWhe7ZEAC
text.10:
Globally, :keycap_digit_five::keycap_digit_zero:% of people with #hypertension may not know that they have it. 

More info :backhand_index_pointing_right:https://t.co/41nS53Umms https://t.co/rclj1Ujk6b
text.12: "The #COVID19 pandemic will end. But more than 1 billion people will still live with #hypertension. That’s why WHO’s vision remains the highest attainable standard of health for everyone, everywhere"-@DrTedros
text.13: "To support countries to take action against cardiovascular diseases, WHO has developed the HEARTS package, which outlines the six key ingredients for addressing threats to heart health, including hypertension"-@DrTedros
text.14: "People with #hypertension are at increased risk of heart disease, kidney damage and stroke, as well severe disease and death from #COVID19, and the #COVID19 pandemic has disrupted services for hypertension in more than half of countries"-@DrTedros
text.15: "Globally, 9 out of 10 people with #hypertension don’t have it under control, and 2 in 5 people with hypertension don’t even know they have it"-@DrTedros #WorldHypertensionDay #BeatNCDs
text.16:
"Today is #WorldHypertensionDay. 

Today has a personal resonance for me, because I am one of the 1.13 billion people globally living with #hypertension. 

I have access to good medical care. But many others who live with hypertension are not so lucky"-@DrTedros #BeatNCDs
text.17: "Another under-utilized tool is the use of antivirals to treat people with #influenza. We encourage all countries to use all the tools at their disposal"-@DrTedros
text.18: "The Strategic Advisory Group of Experts on Immunization has therefore recommended that, among the five risk groups, #healthworkers and older adults are the highest priority groups for #influenza vaccination during the #COVID19 pandemic"-@DrTedros
text.19: "However, one of the challenges we now face is that the demand for #influenza vaccines may outstrip supply in some countries"-@DrTedros
text.20:
"WHO recommends #influenza vaccination for five target groups:
:pregnant_woman: pregnant women
🫀 people with underlying health conditions
:old_man: older adults
:woman_health_worker_selector: #healthworkers
:child: children. 

These groups remain important targets for influenza vaccination"-@DrTedros
text.21: "And although we don’t yet have a safe and effective vaccine for #COVID19, we do have safe and effective vaccines for #influenza"-@DrTedros #VaccinesWork
text.22: "Many of the same measures that are effective in preventing #COVID19 are also effective for preventing #influenza, including physical distancing, #handhygiene, covering coughs, ventilation and masks"-@DrTedros
text.23:
"For that reason, WHO is working with countries to take a holistic approach to the preparedness, prevention, control and treatment of all respiratory diseases, including #influenza and #COVID19"-@DrTedros 

https://t.co/hcCqKF7mNu
text.24: "The co-circulation of #influenza and #COVID19 may present challenges for health systems and health facilities, since both diseases present with many similar symptoms"-@DrTedros
text.25:
"During this year’s southern hemisphere winter, the number of seasonal #flu cases and deaths was less than usual because of the measures put in place to contain #COVID19.

But we cannot assume the same will be true in the northern hemisphere flu season"-@DrTedros
text.26:
"Every hospital bed occupied by a patient with #COVID19 is a bed that is unavailable for someone else with another condition or disease, such as #influenza.

Every year, there are up to 3.5M severe cases of seasonal influenza :globe_showing_Europe-Africa:, & up to 650K respiratory-related deaths"-@DrTedros
text.27: "Although the number of deaths reported in Europe last week is much lower than in March, hospitalizations are increasing and many cities are reporting they will reach their intensive care bed capacity in the coming weeks"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.28:
"Last week, the number of #COVID19 cases reported in Europe was almost 3 times higher than during the first peak in March"-@DrTedros 

https://t.co/XwGn33n3SW
text.29: "As the northern hemisphere winter approaches, cases of #COVID19 are rising :globe_showing_Europe-Africa:, especially in Europe where countries are expanding measures to contain it, & many people are understandably weary of the disruption the pandemic is causing to their lives & livelihoods"-@DrTedros
text.30:
"That’s why WHO and Costa Rica launched the #COVID19 Technology Access Pool, or C-TAP, in late May this year – a voluntary initiative that would allow the benefits of scientific research to be shared and equitably distributed"-@DrTedros 

https://t.co/KxCca4NdML
text.31:
"Ending the #COVID19 pandemic starts with collaboration and sharing at all levels as a global community. 

This includes the sharing of data, knowledge and intellectual property on vital, life-saving health products"-@DrTedros
text.32: "In that spirit, we welcome efforts to expand access to #COVID19 tests, treatments and vaccines, such as South Africa’s and India’s recent proposal to the @wto to waive patents on medical products for COVID-19 until the end of the pandemic"-@DrTedros
text.33: "Through the ACT Accelerator, WHO remains totally committed to speeding up the development of vaccines, diagnostics and therapeutics for #COVID19, and to ensuring their equitable distribution"-@DrTedros #ACTogether
text.34:
"For the moment, the corticosteroid #dexamethasone is still the only therapeutic shown to be effective against #COVID19, for patients with severe disease.

There are still many other ongoing trials of therapeutics identified through the R&D Roadmap for COVID-19"-@DrTedros
text.35: "The Solidarity Trial is still recruiting about 2000 patients every month and will assess other treatments, including monoclonal antibodies and new antivirals"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.36: "We would like to thank all of the patients and clinicians who participated so far in this unprecedented study, and the countries and hospitals who covered the costs of the trial"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.37: "Interim results from the trial now show that the other two drugs in the trial, remdesivir and interferon, have little or no effect in preventing death from #COVID19 or reducing time in hospital"-@DrTedros
text.38:
"In June, we announced that we were discontinuing the hydroxychloroquine arm of the study, and in July we announced that we would no longer enrol patients to receive the combination of lopinavir and ritonavir"-
@DrTedros #COVID19
text.39:
"6 months ago, WHO launched the Solidarity Trial to evaluate the effectiveness of 4 drugs for the #COVID19 treatment.
The Solidarity Trial is the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa:’s largest randomized controlled trial of COVID-19 therapeutics, involving almost 13K patients in 500 :hospital: in 30 countries"-@DrTedros
text.41:
#Malnutrition affects all age groups. Even before the #COVID19 pandemic.

In 2019, among under-5-year-olds :boy::girl_medium_skin_tone::

:white_heavy_check_mark:144 million were stunted or wasted (too short or too thin)
:white_heavy_check_mark: 47 million had low weight for height

:white_heavy_check_mark:38 million were overweight https://t.co/cOynng5WB3
text.42:
Overcoming hunger & #malnutrition is more than securing enough food to survive: what people eat must also be nutritious.
 
Yet :keycap_digit_three: billion people cannot afford a healthy diet. https://t.co/905shru93Y
text.43:
People with cardiovascular disease or diabetes, as well as those with #hypertension and obesity, are at increased risk of severe disease and death from #COVID19.

Learn how to check your blood pressure today! https://t.co/WEfhffh5WX https://t.co/SwYVuYTark
text.44:
"Investment in #hypertension management is more urgent than ever. To help build momentum, today WHO and our @pahowho, are launching a virtual course on accurate blood pressure measurement"-@DrTedros #WorldHypertensionDay #BeatNCDs 

https://t.co/8E1mjSU4yK
text.45:
Today has a personal resonance for me, because I am one of the 1.1 billion people globally living with #hypertension.  

I have access to good medical care. But many others who live with hypertension are not as lucky as me https://t.co/vT9aUOll5y
text.46: "Today we can celebrate the fact that 3M people in 18 countries where the WHO HEARTS technical package has been implemented are better protected from heart disease"-@DrTedros #WorldHypertensionDay #BeatNCDs https://t.co/sdWSwDUC9t
text.47:
"At the same time, we are seeing a rise in behavioural risk factors, such as physical inactivity, diets high in salt, fat and sugar, and harmful use of alcohol"-@DrTedros #WorldHypertensionDay 

https://t.co/1WWoNAdcEd
text.48: "Too many people die too young from cardiovascular disease, because of delayed, incomplete or interrupted treatment of high blood pressure"-@DrTedros #WorldHypertensionDay #BeatNCDs
text.49:
"Like #COVID19, the #hypertension epidemic is hitting the world’s most vulnerable the hardest.  

9 out of 10 people with hypertension don’t have it under control, and 2 in 5 people with hypertension are not aware they have it"-@DrTedros #WorldHypertensionDay
text.50: "In the face of the #COVID19 pandemic, action on #hypertension is more important than ever. People with hypertension are at increased risk of severe COVID-19 & death. In :Italy:, 68% of patients who died in hospital with COVID-19 had hypertension"-@DrTedros #WorldHypertensionDay
text.51:
"#Hypertension is one of the world’s silent killers.  

But it does not have to be. It is within our reach to prevent, diagnose and treat"-@DrTedros #WorldHypertensionDay 

https://t.co/1WWoNAdcEd
text.52:
"Today has a personal resonance for me, because I am one of the 1.1 billion people globally living with #hypertension.  

I have access to good medical care. But many others who live with hypertension are not as lucky as me"-@DrTedros #WorldHypertensionDay
text.54:
DYK: Before the #COVID19 pandemic, over 2 billion people did not have regular access to safe, nutritious & sufficient food.

130 million more people could now fall into chronic hunger by the end of 2020. 

:backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/pcZ9byhlXe https://t.co/JtCCRajt9U
text.55:
This is how you can prevent high blood pressure:

:exclamation_mark:Reduce :salt: to less than 5g/day
:exclamation_mark:Avoid saturated fats & trans fats :hamburger:
:exclamation_mark:Avoid :cigarette:
:exclamation_mark:Reduce :wine_glass:
:white_exclamation_mark:Eat :red_apple: and :broccoli: regularly
:white_exclamation_mark:Be active :woman_in_lotus_position_selector::person_swimming:‍

#BeatNCDs https://t.co/aoDRLOROao
text.56:
Letting #COVID19 spread through populations, of any age or health status, will lead to unnecessary infections, suffering and death. Without a widely available vaccine, herd immunity is a dangerous and counter-productive strategy for stopping the virus.

:backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/X9N7zcyfOX https://t.co/hzVdMKFnmN
text.57:
Join us now for a live discussion about the winner :trophy: of the #MentalHealth prize of WHO's first #HealthForAll film festival: Knock on my Door
https://t.co/tKPHS8WUMg
text.58:
It's #WorldFoodDay! :red_apple::leafy_green::carrot:

With tens of millions of people at risk of falling into extreme poverty & malnutrition because of #COVID19 pandemic, global solidarity & support are needed more to than ever to help those in need.

:backhand_index_pointing_right:https://t.co/jOcBSncFEE https://t.co/c9WlY3OVDQ
text.59:
Achieving herd immunity with safe and effective vaccines makes diseases rarer and saves lives.
 
:backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/X9N7zcyfOX

https://t.co/oRJTq3oQ1Y
text.60:
Join WHO for the #WorldHypertensionDay event to learn more about preventing and managing hypertension with @DrTedros, @ResolveTSL, @didierdrogba foundation, @WorldHyperLeag and @ISHBP. 

More information :backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/pwikR9x4YY https://t.co/A4LzeHa158
text.61:
Today is #WorldHypertensionDay.

Hypertension - or elevated blood pressure - is a serious medical condition that significantly increases the risks of :red_heart:, :brain:, kidney & other diseases.

It is a major cause of premature death worldwide. :backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/UJWFv9JGY4 https://t.co/AnLCr2swuf
text.62:
Herd immunity or population immunity is achieved by protecting people from a virus, not by exposing them to it. With herd immunity, the vast majority of a population are vaccinated, :down_arrow_selector: the overall amount of virus able to spread in the whole population.

:backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/X9N7zcyfOX https://t.co/MVZl6zgoLp
text.63:
Herd immunity is a concept used for vaccination, in which a population can be protected from a virus if a threshold of vaccination is reached. Vaccinated people are protected from getting the disease & passing it on, breaking any chains of transmission.

:backhand_index_pointing_right:https://t.co/X9N7zcyfOX https://t.co/V22iA6OqOq
text.64:
Newer antiviral drugs, immunomodulators and anti-SARS COV-2 monoclonal antibodies are now being considered for evaluation for new #COVID19 treatment options.

:backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/g5vWTbi29c https://t.co/miFNfoD4UX
text.65:
The global platform of the Solidarity Trial is ready to rapidly evaluate promising new #COVID19 treatment options, with nearly 500 hospitals open as trial sites.

:backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/g5vWTbi29c https://t.co/c1aDavsym2
text.66:
The progress achieved by the Solidarity Therapeutics Trial shows that large international trials are possible, even during #COVID19 pandemic, & offer the promise of quickly & reliably answering critical public health questions concerning therapeutics.

:backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/A2TiM4QCkL https://t.co/ogsJiLn1OO
text.67: I am very grateful to all members & especially to the chair of the advisory group, @CassSunstein, for their time &  advice on how best to increase #vaccine demand in settings with high virus transmission & low demand, & to forewarn on risk reduction & equity. #COVID19
text.68: Glad to speak with the @WHO Technical Advisory Group on #BehaviouralInsights & Sciences to discuss #vaccine acceptance & uptake in the context of #COVID19. We are committed to ensuring behavioural science is at the heart of all of our work. https://t.co/K1sHemYXiU
text.69: Interim results from the Solidarity Therapeutics Trial, coordinated by WHO, indicate that remdesivir, hydroxychloroquine, lopinavir/ritonavir & interferon regimens appeared to have little or no effect on mortality or reduction in hospital stays for #COVID19 patients. https://t.co/eNoW6HL0y3
text.70:
In just six months, the world’s largest randomized control trial on #COVID19 therapeutics has generated conclusive evidence on the effectiveness of repurposed drugs for the treatment of COVID-19.

 :backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/A2TiM4QCkL https://t.co/I65Y0aPHPa
